title: Diversity and Inclusion Data
description: Sharing data around diversity and inclusion within organisations

properties.title: Publishing date
properties.description: The date associated with the row in ISO 8601 format as recommended by GDS. This reduces ambiguity in parsing dates and gives flexibility with time precision. It can be reported as just a year (e.g. '2021'), a month (e.g. '2021-01'), or a full date (e.g. '2021-01-26'). This allows an organisation to publish figures as frequently as they need to.

properties.title: Organisation
properties.description: The name of the organisation.

properties.title: Grouping
properties.description: This allows you to breakdown the data by a sub-division, area, or group within the organisation.

properties.title: Level
properties.description: This allows you to breakdown the data by a particular salary percentile e.g. 'LowerQuartile', 'LowerMiddleQuartile', 'UpperMiddleQuartile', 'TopQuartile'

properties.title: Employees
properties.description: A number representing the total number of employees.

properties.title: Link to DEI info
properties.description: A link to a diversity and inclusion policy (similar to the CompanyLinkToGPGInfo field provided in gender pay gap reporting)

properties.title: SIC codes
properties.description: Semi-colon-separated list of SIC codes as used by Companies House.
properties.patterndesc: Must be valid SIC codes separated by semi-colons

sections.title: Age
sections.description: This section is about age. It is optional as are each of the columns. A response rate will be calculated using the age_undisclosed value and the total. These were based on an attempt to find common age brackets from the existing employers who had shared data. The ONS use 5-year bands which match with these (mostly) 10 year bands. In under 25s the ONS use 15-17, and 18-24 but none of the existing employers report under 16s.

properties.description: The number of employees aged from 0-14 inclusive ie. not yet 15.
The number of employees aged from 15 to 24 inclusive ie. not yet 25.
The number of employees aged from 25 to 34 inclusive ie. not yet 35.
The number of employees aged from 35 to 44 inclusive ie. not yet 45.
The number of employees aged from 45 to 54 inclusive ie. not yet 55.
The number of employees aged from 55 to 64 inclusive ie. not yet 65.
The number of employees aged from 65 to 69 inclusive ie. not yet 70.
The number of employees aged 70 or over.

properties.title: Prefer not to say
properties.description: For consistency across categories this can be provided if needed.

properties.title: Undisclosed
properties.description: The number of employees for whom no age is known. This allows us to calculate “response” rates. Assumed to be 0 if not included.

properties.title: Total
properties.description: The total number of people this category applies to. If not provided it will be assumed to be the same as employees. If it is the same as employees it can be omitted.

sections.title: Carers
sections.description: This section is about those who are carers for others. It is optional as are each of the columns. A response rate will be calculated using the carers_undisclosed value and the total. These options are based on question 14 of the 2011 Census (which is a super-set of question 24 of the 2021 Census).

properties.title: Carers
properties.description: The total number of people who look after, or give any help or support to, anyone because they have long-term physical or mental health conditions or illnesses, or problems related to old age (see Q24 Census 2021 Individual).

properties.title: Carers (1-19 hours/week)
properties.description: Yes, 1-19 hours a week (the sum of 1-9 and 10-19 in the 2021 Census).

properties.title: Carers (20-49 hours/week)
properties.description: Yes, 20 - 49 hours a week (the sum of 20-34 and 35-49 in the 2021 Census).

properties.title: Carers (50+ hours/week)
properties.description: Yes, 50 or more hours a week

properties.title: Not carers
properties.description: Those who are not a carer

properties.title: Prefer not to say
properties.description: The number of people who prefer not to say

properties.title: Undisclosed
properties.description: The number of employees who were not asked or who didn’t respond actively. This allows us to calculate 'response' rates. Assumed to be 0 if not included.

properties.title: Total
properties.description: The total number of people. If not provided it will be assumed to be the same as employees. If it is the same as employees it can be omitted.

sections.title: Disability
sections.description: This section is about disability. It is optional as are each of the columns. A response rate will be calculated using the disability_undisclosed value and the total. These mostly come from the categories that Yorkshire Water currently publish which are aligned with the Equality Act disability definition answers to Q1 and Q3 of the ONS's Opinion and Lifestyle Survey (OPD). GSS guidance.

properties.title: Has a disability
properties.description: The total number of people who have a long-term health problem or disability. In the ONS OPD Q1 is “Do you have any physical or mental health conditions or illnesses?” Answers: yes/no.

properties.title: Reduce ability to work a lot
properties.description: The number of people whose day-to-day activities are limited a lot. This allows a breakdown within the category of disability_yes if known. In the ONS OPD Q3 is “Do any of your illnesses or conditions reduce your ability to carry out day to day activities?” Answer: yes a lot

properties.title: Reduce ability to work a little
properties.description: The number of people whose day-to-day activities are limited a little. This allows a breakdown within the category of disability_yes if known. In the ONS OPD Q3 is “Do any of your illnesses or conditions reduce your ability to carry out day to day activities?” Answer: yes a little

properties.title: No disability
properties.description: The number of people with no disability.

properties.title: Prefer not to say
properties.description: The number of people who prefer not to say

properties.title: Undisclosed
properties.description: The number of employees who were not asked or who didn’t respond actively. This allows us to calculate 'response' rates. Assumed to be 0 if not included.

properties.title: Total
properties.description: The total number of people. If not provided it will be assumed to be the same as employees. If it is the same as employees it can be omitted.

sections.title: Ethnicity
sections.description: This section is about ethnicity. It is optional as are each of the columns. A response rate will be calculated using the ethnicity_undisclosed value and the total. These come from ONS Census categories so are very UK-centric.

properties.title: Asian or Asian British
properties.description: The Census group “Asian/Asian British”.

properties.title: Bangladeshi
properties.description: Not required. Allows some organisations to provide more detailed breakdown if they wish and are able to. The Census group of “Bangladeshi”.

properties.title: Chinese
properties.description: Not required. Allows some organisations to provide more detailed breakdown if they wish and are able to. The Census group of “Chinese”.

properties.title: Indian
properties.description: Not required. Allows some organisations to provide more detailed breakdown if they wish and are able to. The Census group of “Indian”.

properties.title: Pakistani
properties.description: Not required. Allows some organisations to provide more detailed breakdown if they wish and are able to. The Census group of “Pakistani”.

properties.title: Other
properties.description: Not required. Allows some organisations to provide more detailed breakdown if they wish and are able to. The Census group of “Other”.

properties.title: Black, African, Caribbean or Black British
properties.description: The Census group “Black, African, Caribbean or Black British”.

properties.title: African
properties.description: Not required. Allows some organisations to provide more detailed breakdown if they wish and are able to. The Census group of “African”.

properties.title: Caribbean
properties.description: Not required. Allows some organisations to provide more detailed breakdown if they wish and are able to. The Census group of “Caribbean”.

properties.title: Any other Black, African or Caribbean background
properties.description: Not required. Allows some organisations to provide more detailed breakdown if they wish and are able to. The Census group of “Any other Black, African or Caribbean background”.

properties.title: Mixed or Multiple ethnic groups
properties.description: The Census group “Mixed or Multiple ethnic groups”.

properties.title: White and Black African
properties.description: Not required. Allows some organisations to provide more detailed breakdown if they wish and are able to. The Census group of “White and Black African”.

properties.title: White and Asian
properties.description: Not required. Allows some organisations to provide more detailed breakdown if they wish and are able to. The Census group of “White and Asian”.

properties.title: White and Black Caribbean
properties.description: Not required. Allows some organisations to provide more detailed breakdown if they wish and are able to. The Census group of “White and Black Caribbean”.

properties.title: Any other Mixed or Multiple ethnic background
properties.description: Not required. Allows some organisations to provide more detailed breakdown if they wish and are able to. The Census group of “Any other Mixed or Multiple ethnic background”.

properties.title: Other ethnic group
properties.description: The Census group “Other ethnic group”.

properties.title: Arab
properties.description: Not required. Allows some organisations to provide more detailed breakdown if they wish and are able to. The Census group of “Arab”.

properties.title: Any other ethnic group
properties.description: Not required. Allows some organisations to provide more detailed breakdown if they wish and are able to. The Census group of “Any other ethnic group”.

properties.title: White
properties.description: The Census group “White”.

properties.title: English, Welsh, Scottish, Northern Irish or British
properties.description: Not required. Allows some organisations to provide more detailed breakdown if they wish and are able to. The Census group of “English, Welsh, Scottish, Northern Irish or British”.

properties.title: Irish
properties.description: Not required. Allows some organisations to provide more detailed breakdown if they wish and are able to. The Census group of “Irish”.

properties.title: Gypsy or Irish Traveller
properties.description: Not required. Allows some organisations to provide more detailed breakdown if they wish and are able to. The Census group of “Gypsy or Irish Traveller”.

properties.title: Any other White background
properties.description: Not required. Allows some organisations to provide more detailed breakdown if they wish and are able to. The Census group of “Any other White background”.

properties.title: Prefer not to say
properties.description: The number of people who prefer not to say

properties.title: Undisclosed
properties.description: The number of employees who were not asked or who didn’t respond actively. This allows us to calculate 'response' rates. Assumed to be 0 if not included.

properties.title: Total
properties.description: The total number of people. If not provided it will be assumed to be the same as employees. If it is the same as employees it can be omitted.

sections.title: Gender
sections.description: This section is about sex and gender identity. It is optional as are each of the columns. A response rate will be calculated using the gender_undisclosed value and the gender_total. These are based on what some existing employers currently report.

properties.title: Female
properties.description: The number of employees who are female (including trans).

properties.title: Male
properties.description: The number of employees who are male (including trans).

properties.title: Other
properties.description: Diverse and other genders including non-binary.

properties.title: Prefer not to say
properties.description: The number of people who prefer not to say

properties.title: Undisclosed
properties.description: The number of employees who were not asked or who didn’t respond actively. This allows us to calculate 'response' rates. Assumed to be 0 if not included.

properties.title: Total
properties.description: The total number of people. If not provided it will be assumed to be the same as employees. If it is the same as employees it can be omitted.

properties.title: Matches that assigned at birth
properties.description: The number of employees whose gender matches that assigned at birth

properties.title: Doesn't match that assigned at birth
properties.description: The number of employees whose gender doesn’t match that assigned at birth

properties.title: Prefer not to say
properties.description: The number of people who prefer not to say

properties.title: Undisclosed
properties.description: The number of employees who were not asked or who didn’t respond actively. This allows us to calculate 'response' rates. Assumed to be 0 if not included.

properties.title: Total
properties.description: The total number of people. If not provided it will be assumed to be the same as employees. If it is the same as employees it can be omitted.

sections.title: Religion
sections.description: This section is about religion. It is optional as are each of the columns. A response rate will be calculated using the religion_undisclosed value and the total. These are based on the categories used by the ONS in the 2021 Census. The sum of individual responses may add up to more than the total number of people.

properties.title: Buddhist
properties.description: The number of employees who are Buddhist

properties.title: Christian
properties.description: The number of employees who are Christian

properties.title: Hindu
properties.description: The number of employees who are Hindu

properties.title: Jewish
properties.description: The number of employees who are Jewish

properties.title: Muslim
properties.description: The number of employees who are Muslim

properties.title: No religion
properties.description: The number of employees who are “No Religion”

properties.title: Other
properties.description: The number of employees who are “Other”

properties.title: Sikh
properties.description: The number of employees who are “Sikh”

properties.title: Prefer not to say
properties.description: The number of people who prefer not to say

properties.title: Undisclosed
properties.description: The number of employees who were not asked or who didn’t respond actively. This allows us to calculate 'response' rates. Assumed to be 0 if not included.

properties.title: Total
properties.description: The total number of people. If not provided it will be assumed to be the same as employees. If it is the same as employees it can be omitted.

sections.title: Sexuality
sections.description: This section is about sexuality. It is optional as are each of the columns. A response rate will be calculated using the sexuality_undisclosed value and the total. These are based on guidance from the Government Statistical Service (17 April 2019) and similar to the 2021 Census but using language from the Australian Bureau of Statistics (GSS are drawing on ABS’s approach soon).

properties.title: Bisexual
properties.description: The number of employees who are bisexual

properties.title: Gay or lesbian
properties.description: The number of employees who are gay or lesbian

properties.title: Straight (heterosexual)
properties.description: The number of employees who are heterosexual/straight

properties.title: Use a different term
properties.description: The number of employees who would use a different term - this may be done in the form of a write-in box.

properties.title: Prefer not to say
properties.description: The number of people who prefer not to say

properties.title: Undisclosed
properties.description: The number of employees who were not asked or who didn’t respond actively. This allows us to calculate 'response' rates. Assumed to be 0 if not included.

properties.title: Total
properties.description: The total number of people. If not provided it will be assumed to be the same as employees. If it is the same as employees it can be omitted.

sections.title: Socio-economic background
sections.description: This section is about socio-economic background (SEB). Measuring or estimating socio-economic background is hard including when you ask people to self-identify. All measures are going to be proxies to a complicated question. We have chosen to use the four questions used by The Social Mobility Commission toolkit.

properties.title: Q1. What was the occupation of your main household earner when you were about aged 14?
properties.description:
The Social Mobility Commission toolkit suggests this is a key question employers could ask because:
“[T]his question is the best measure to assess someone’s socio-economic background. Not only that but it’s easy to understand, it gets the highest response rates in testing, and it’s applicable to those from all ages and from all countries.”

properties.title: Lower
properties.description: The number of employees who, at about 14, had their main household earner from a lower socio-economic background – technical and craft occupations; routine, semi-routine manual and service occupations; long-term unemployed.

properties.title: Intermediate
properties.description: The number of employees who, at about 14, had their main household earner from an intermediate background – clerical and intermediate occupations; small business owners

properties.title: Professional
properties.description: The number of employees who, at about 14, had their main household earner from a professional background – modern professional & traditional occupations; senior or junior managers or administrators.

properties.title: Prefer not to say
properties.description: The number of people who prefer not to say

properties.title: Undisclosed
properties.description: The number of employees who were not asked or who didn’t respond actively. This allows us to calculate 'response' rates. Assumed to be 0 if not included.

properties.title: Total
properties.description: The total number of people. If not provided it will be assumed to be the same as employees. If it is the same as employees it can be omitted.

properties.title: Q2. Which type of school did you attend for the most time between the ages of 11 and 16?
Independent
properties.description: The number of employees who attended an Independent or fee-paying school

properties.title: Independent with bursary
properties.description: The number of employees who attended an Independent or fee-paying school, where they received a means tested bursary covering 90% or more of the total cost of attending throughout their time there.

properties.title: Outside the UK
properties.description: The number of employees who attended a school outside the UK

properties.title: State-run
properties.description: The number of employees who attended a state-run or state-funded school

properties.title: Prefer not to say
properties.description: The number of people who prefer not to say

properties.title: Undisclosed
properties.description: The number of employees who were not asked or who didn’t respond actively. This allows us to calculate 'response' rates. Assumed to be 0 if not included.

properties.title: Total
properties.description: The total number of people. If not provided it will be assumed to be the same as employees. If it is the same as employees it can be omitted.

properties.title: Q3. If you finished school after 1980, were you eligible for free school meals at any point during your school years?
No
properties.description: The number of employees who didn’t receive free school meals at any point during their school years.

properties.title: Not applicable
properties.description: The number of employees who to whom this doesn’t apply because finished school before 1980 or went to school overseas.

properties.title: Yes
properties.description: The number of employees who received free school meals at any point during their school years.

properties.title: Prefer not to say
properties.description: The number of people who prefer not to say

properties.title: Undisclosed
properties.description: The number of employees who were not asked or who didn’t respond actively. This allows us to calculate 'response' rates. Assumed to be 0 if not included.

properties.title: Total
properties.description: The total number of people. If not provided it will be assumed to be the same as employees. If it is the same as employees it can be omitted.

properties.title: Q4. Did either of your parents attend university and gain a degree (e.g. BA/BSc or equivalent) by the time you were 18?
properties.description: Surveys such as the Longitudinal Survey of Young People in England answer questions such as “are you first in your family to go to university” but this isn’t open data so comparisons at geographies such as “Leeds City Region” won’t be possible. The UK Data Service estimates 15% of those born in 1990 were first-in-family to attend university.

properties.title: No
properties.description: The number of employees for whom neither parent attended university.

properties.title: Not sure
properties.description: The number of employees who are unsure if their parents attended university.

properties.title: Yes
properties.description: The number of employees who had at least one parent attend university.

properties.title: Prefer not to say
properties.description: The number of people who prefer not to say

properties.title: Undisclosed
properties.description: The number of employees who were not asked or who didn’t respond actively. This allows us to calculate 'response' rates. Assumed to be 0 if not included.

properties.title: Total
properties.description: The total number of people. If not provided it will be assumed to be the same as employees. If it is the same as employees it can be omitted.
